Beijing bans 'negative emotions' on social media
subhead: The Chinese government has launched a crackdown on online content, targeting posts deemed too pessimistic or divisive amid a national economic slowdown. Several influencers have already faced penalties.

title: US federal agent shoots Chicago motorist as protests spread, while a judge blocks troops to Portland
subhead: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker announced the Trump administration's plans to federalize 300 members of the Illinois National Guard, calling the decision 'absolutely outrageous and un-American.' Also on Saturday, US District Judge Karin Immergut blocked Trump's bid to deploy troops into Portland.
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: If you love Eugène Boudin, you will love Honfleur
subhead: The Impressionist painter has a museum named after him in this popular Normandy tourist town, where he was born. Many other artists have been drawn here by the ever-changing light of the estuary.

title: The dyeing marvels of 'magician' Serge Haouzi
subhead: Serge Haouzi is a master of color. In his studios in a southern Paris suburb, the director of Les Teintures de France and his team of colorists develop and enhance textile pieces for leading fashion houses. Their expertise relies on both artisanal processes and cutting-edge technology.

title: Why foreigners love France but struggle with the French
subhead: While France captivates with its culture and lifestyle, the French, frequently caricatured as arrogant and impolite, often have a poor reputation. This ambivalence raises questions about the roots of anti-French sentiment abroad.

title: Former American diplomat Robert Malley: 'Trump's Gaza plan offers more ambiguities and potential pitfalls than clear answers'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, Robert Malley, who participated in peace negotiations between Israel and Palestine under Bill Clinton, Barack Obama and Joe Biden, sees Donald Trump's plan as yet another attempt that fails to take history into account. In particular, he questions the relevance of the two-state solution.
